title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2500.1 - Disclosure of New York reportable transactions and related information
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2500.1 - Disclosure of New York reportable transactions and related information

State Regulations
(a) Authorization. Section
25 (a)(3)
of the Tax Law
authorizes the commissioner to promulgate regulations with regard to New York
reportable transactions. (b) Brief
description of a New York reportable transaction. A New York reportable
transaction is a transaction that has the potential to be a tax avoidance
transaction under article 9, 9-A, 22, 32, or 33 of the Tax Law. (c) Purpose. Taxpayers who participate in New

York reportable transactions are required to disclose their participation to
the department. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
2500.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
